pullRequest.body:
This PR develops the API for cartesian products of categories (natural isomorphisms, equivalences, morphism properties) in order to show that under simple assumptions, the localized category of a product of two categories identifies to a product of the localized categories.

---

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7020511614/job/19100401483)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7020511614/job/19100401024)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7020511614/job/19100400710)
Shouldn't we always just use `have` now instead of `haveI`?
`haveI` inlines the term, which might lead to a cleaner definition. For proofs, it is certainly true that you can always just use `have`.

```suggestion
/-- The product of two localized categories satisfies the universal property
of localized categories. -/
noncomputable def prod :
```
Maybe add a docstring here since this is the main result of the file?
Thanks. I have added a docstring.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): the localized category of a product category

source.title: feat/refactor: redefinition of homology + derived categories
